content.3: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
content.4: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.
content.5: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
content.6: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;
content.7: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
content.9: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,
content.10: And brake up for it my decreed
content.11: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
content.12: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days;
content.13: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
content.15: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.
content.16: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
content.17: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
content.18: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.
content.20: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths
content.22: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
content.23: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
content.24: By what way is the light parted,
content.25: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;
content.26: To cause it to rain on the earth,
content.27: To satisfy the desolate and waste
content.28: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
content.29: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
content.31: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
content.32: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
content.33: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?
content.34: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
content.35: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we
content.36: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?
content.37: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
content.38: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
content.39: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,
content.41: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
